meanings.definition: Tormented or haunted by a hag or evil spirit.
meanings.sent1: The hagridden man felt a chill whenever he passed the old graveyard.
meanings.sent2: The village was hagridden by tales of the ghostly figure that roamed the streets at night.
meanings.sent3: The hagridden cat seemed to hiss at invisible shadows, much to the amusement of the children.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a hagridden place, filled with dark memories that refused to fade.
meanings.sent5: The hagridden forest whispered eerie secrets to those who dared to enter its depths.

meanings.sent1: The hagridden student struggled with the difficult math problems every day.
meanings.sent2: The town was hagridden by a series of unfortunate events that affected everyone.
meanings.sent3: The hagridden car always seemed to break down at the worst possible times, much to the frustration of its owner.
meanings.sent4: His hagridden past followed him like a shadow, never letting him forget his mistakes.
meanings.sent5: The hagridden sky poured rain relentlessly, soaking everything in its path.
